title: US News Today Live Updates on December 26, 2024 : How did NASA astronauts get Christmas decorations in space? Social media wants answers | Today News - Mint
summary:
US News Today Live Updates on December 26, 2024: How did NASA astronauts get Christmas decorations in space? Social media wants answers

Published on: 26 Dec, 2024 by LiveMint

NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams brought Christmas cheer to the International Space Station (ISS), raising questions on social media regarding the logistics of getting festive decorations into space.

  • Astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams brought Christmas cheer to the ISS, donning Santa hats despite being stranded in orbit since June. Social media buzzed with playful questions about how festive decorations made it on their originally short mission, sparking intrigue about space logistics.
“In today’s dynamic landscape, staying updated on the latest developments across the United States is essential,” the report states.

This event highlights the unique blend of human experience and space exploration, reminding us of the personal connections that endure even in the most challenging environments.
newTitle: NASA Astronauts Celebrate Christmas in Space: Social Media Questions Logistics

title: 'Speak in united voice': NDA leaders discuss plan in key meet to counter Congress' Ambedkar attack - The Times of India
summary:
NDA Leaders Align to Counter Congress' Criticism of Ambedkar

Publication Date: October 15, 2023 Source: The Times of India

This article discusses a critical meeting among leaders of the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in response to Congress' recent attacks regarding their stance on Dr. B.R. Ambedkar. The NDA leaders are strategizing to present a unified front.

  • NDA leaders emphasize the need for a united voice.
  • The meeting is a direct response to Congress' criticisms.
  • Strategies discussed to reinforce their stance on Ambedkar's legacy.
“We must speak in a united voice to address these politically motivated attacks.” - NDA Senior Leader

The NDA's response is crucial in shaping the political narrative surrounding Ambedkar and addressing public sentiment during this charged political climate.
newTitle: NDA Leaders Align to Counter Congress' Criticism of Ambedkar

title: Doctors stunned to find 27 contact lenses in woman's eye; here's how it happened - The Times of India
summary:
Doctors Stunned to Find 27 Contact Lenses in Woman's Eye

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: Live Science

A routine cataract surgery turned into a medical mystery when doctors found 27 contact lenses trapped under a 67-year-old woman's eyelid. She had worn monthly disposable lenses for 35 years without regular check-ups and experienced only minor discomfort.

  • The woman had no major vision issues despite her contact lenses being trapped.
  • Doctors discovered the lenses when administering anesthetic for cataract surgery.
  • A clump of 17 lenses was found, with 10 more located using a microscope.
  • The surgery was postponed for two weeks due to potential infection risks.
  • The woman assumed a missing lens had been dropped and was unaware of the accumulation.
  • Doctors emphasized the importance of monitoring contact lens users properly.
“While it wasn’t clear how so many contact lenses ended up under the patient’s eyelid…”

This unusual case highlights the need for regular eye check-ups for contact lens users to prevent similar incidents.
newTitle: Doctors Stunned to Find 27 Contact Lenses in Woman's Eye

AIMIM plans to field 2020 Delhi riots accused Shahrukh Pathan, who pointed gun at cops, in assembly polls - Hindustan Times
summary:
AIMIM Considers Shahrukh Pathan for Delhi Assembly Elections

Publication Date: Dec 25, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) is contemplating the candidacy of Shahrukh Pathan, an accused from the 2020 Delhi riots, for the upcoming assembly elections.

  • Shahrukh Pathan has been in Tihar jail since March 2020 for his role in the riots.
  • His candidacy is not yet finalized, according to AIMIM sources.
  • AIMIM's Delhi unit intends to contest 12 assembly seats.
  • The assembly elections are scheduled for February next year, amidst a competitive political landscape in Delhi.
“Pathan’s name is being considered for candidacy, but no official decision has been made.” - Shoaib Jamei, AIMIM’s Delhi unit president

The potential nomination of Shahrukh Pathan highlights AIMIM's strategy in the forthcoming elections and raises significant questions about candidate selection amid ongoing legal challenges.
newTitle: AIMIM Considers Shahrukh Pathan for Delhi Assembly Elections

title: M.T. Vasudevan Nair, doyen of Malayalam literature and cinema, passes away - The Hindu
summary:
M.T. Vasudevan Nair, Doyen of Malayalam Literature and Cinema, Passes Away

Published on December 25, 2024, by The Hindu

Renowned writer and filmmaker M.T. Vasudevan Nair passed away in Kozhikode at the age of 91. He was a significant figure in Malayalam literature and cinema, known for his revolutionary contributions to screenplay writing and his timeless novels.

  • M.T. Vasudevan Nair died on December 25, 2024, in Kozhikode.
  • He was celebrated for his novels such as Randamoozham and Asuravithu.
  • His film debut as a director, Nirmalyam, won the National Award for Best Film in 1974.
  • Many of his works have become part of Malayali cultural life and continue to be published.
  • He was awarded the Jnanpith Award in 1995 and was a prolific screenwriter.
“M.T. championed modernism in his works.” - Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan

M.T. Vasudevan Nair's passing marks the end of an era in Malayalam literature and cinema, leaving behind a legacy that will continue to inspire future generations.
newTitle: M.T. Vasudevan Nair, Doyen of Malayalam Literature and Cinema, Passes Away

title: Baby John box office collection day 1: Varun Dhawan film fails to beat Vijay's Theri, remake opens at ₹12 crore - Hindustan Times
summary:
Baby John Box Office Collection Day 1: The Varun Dhawan-Starrer Opens to Mixed Reviews

Publication Date: Dec 25, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Varun Dhawan-starrer 'Baby John' opened on December 25 but failed to beat the box office collection of its predecessor 'Theri'.

  • As per early estimates, 'Baby John' collected ₹12.5 crore on its opening day.
  • The film had 24.53% Hindi occupancy on the release day.
  • 'Theri' had an opening day collection of ₹13.1 crore despite only being released in Tamil Nadu.
  • 'Pushpa 2' continues to outperform 'Baby John' with ₹20.7 crore collection.
  • Directed by Kalees and produced by Atlee, the film stars also Jackie Shroff and Rajpal Yadav, with a cameo by Salman Khan.
The film starts off on a very choppy note, and there’s no soul for about 40 minutes.

In conclusion, 'Baby John' showcased a decent performance, but it struggled to surpass its competitors and faced criticism for its direction and storyline.
newTitle: Baby John Box Office Collection Day 1: Varun Dhawan Film Falls Short of Theri's Opening

title: Justin Baldoni Sued By Former Publicist Amid Blake Lively's Sexual Misconduct Charge - NDTV
summary:
Justin Baldoni Sued By Former Publicist Amid Blake Lively's Sexual Misconduct Charge

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 Source: New York Post

Justin Baldoni's former publicist, Stephanie Jones, has filed a lawsuit against him and his current publicity team, alleging breach of contract and involvement in a smear campaign against Blake Lively.

  • The lawsuit claims Baldoni failed to pay $25,000 per month as per their contract.
  • Jones alleges she had no involvement in a smear campaign against Lively and that Abel and Nathan are deflecting blame to her.
  • Jones discovered evidence of a retaliation campaign against Lively upon reviewing company correspondence.
  • Blake Lively has also filed a lawsuit against Baldoni for sexual harassment and misconduct, claiming a hostile work environment.
  • Allegations against Baldoni include inappropriate behavior and ignoring boundaries during filming of 'It Ends With Us.'
"To this day, Abel and Nathan continue to point the finger falsely at Jones now that their own misconduct is coming to light, and to defame and attack Jones in the industry."

The allegations raise serious questions regarding workplace conduct and the treatment of actors in Hollywood, highlighting ongoing issues of power dynamics and harassment in the film industry.
newTitle: Justin Baldoni Sued By Former Publicist Amid Blake Lively's Sexual Misconduct Charge

title: India reports zero malaria cases in 122 districts in 2023: Centre - The New Indian Express
summary:
India Reports Zero Malaria Cases in 122 Districts in 2023

Date: 2023

Source: Union Health Ministry

India has marked a significant milestone in its fight against malaria, reporting zero cases in 122 districts in 2023, while also exiting the WHO's high burden to high impact group.

  • Over 97% reduction in malaria cases since 1947.
  • Annual malaria cases dropped from 7.5 crore to 20 lakhs.
  • Malaria-related deaths decreased from 800,000 to just 83.
  • The National Framework for Malaria Elimination aims for a malaria-free India by 2030.
  • India's exit from the WHO's HBHI group marks a turning point in public health efforts.
“This historic achievement underscores India’s commitment to eliminating malaria and improving public health for its citizens,” said the ministry.

The success in reducing malaria cases and deaths highlights India's robust public health strategies and community engagement in the fight against malaria.
newTitle: India Reports Zero Malaria Cases in 122 Districts in 2023

India Cements board undergoes rejig, CEO N Srinivasan resigns after UltraTech's acquisition deal; details here | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
India Cements Board Restructured After UltraTech's Acquisition

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Live Mint

India Cement's board is undergoing restructuring following UltraTech Cement's ₹7,000-crore acquisition. CEO N Srinivasan, along with other board members, has resigned.

  • N Srinivasan and other board members tendered their resignations.
  • UltraTech Cement acquired a 32.72% stake in India Cements.
  • CFO R Srinivasan set to retire on January 1, 2025.
  • Remaining board appointed four new directors and several independent directors.
“With this acquisition, UltraTech Cement becomes the majority shareholder in India Cements.”

The board restructuring marks a significant transition in India Cements as it consolidates ownership under UltraTech.
newTitle: India Cements Board Restructured After UltraTech's Acquisition

title: One tourist dead, 12 rescued after boat capsizes off Goa’s Calangute beach - The Indian Express
summary:
One tourist dead, 12 rescued after boat capsizes off Goa’s Calangute beach

Publication Date: Wednesday
Source: Coastal Police

A tragic incident occurred at Calangute beach in North Goa, where a tourist boat capsized, resulting in one death and twelve rescues.

  • A 45-year-old tourist from Maharashtra, Suryakant Pophalkar, was declared dead.
  • The boat was carrying 11 family members from Ratnagiri district.
  • The incident happened around 12.30 pm when the boat was approximately 70 meters from the coastline.
  • Preliminary reports suggest a motor malfunction led to the capsizing.
  • All passengers were rescued and taken to a health center; six were referred for further observation.
  • There are ongoing investigations into potential negligence.
“According to preliminary information, the boat was about 70 metres from the coastline when its motor is alleged to have malfunctioned.” - Police Officer

This tragic event highlights the importance of safety measures in water sports, including weight limits and the provision of life jackets.
newTitle: Tragic Boat Capsize Off Goa's Calangute Beach Claims One Life

summary:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Melbourne Weather Forecast: Will MCG Suffer Gabba Fate with WTC Final Spot at Stake?

Date: December 25, 2024 08:42 PM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

As the fourth Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series approaches, the spotlight is on both the teams and the Melbourne weather, particularly with World Test Championship (WTC) qualification at stake.

  • The previous game in Brisbane ended in a draw, keeping the series tied at 1-1 after three matches.
  • Australia lost Josh Hazlewood to injury and replaced him with Scott Boland, while India has named uncapped Tanush Kotian to replace retiree Ravichandran Ashwin.
  • The Melbourne weather forecast predicts minimal rain for the first three days, with only a 24% chance of rain expected on Day 3.
  • India's hopes of qualifying for the WTC final hinge on the outcome of this match, as a loss or draw would eliminate them.
  • Australia also has upcoming matches that impact their qualification chances.
If India loses or draws, they could be eliminated from the race to the WTC final.

The outcome of this Test match is crucial for both teams as they aim for a spot in the WTC final, with weather conditions also playing a significant role in the proceedings.
newTitle: India vs Australia 4th Test: Weather Forecast and WTC Final Stakes

title: Scientists develop scan that unravels secrets of lung function - Ahmedabad Mirror
India poised to be malaria-free by 2030: Health ministry - Hindustan Times
summary:
India Poised to Achieve Malaria-Free Status by 2030

Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

India has made significant progress in reducing malaria cases over the past 75 years, with a goal to become malaria-free by 2030, according to the Union health ministry.

  • The number of malaria cases has decreased from 75 million at independence to 2 million in 2023.
  • Annual malaria deaths have dropped from 800,000 to 83.
  • 122 districts reported no new malaria cases.
  • India exited the WHO's High Burden to High Impact group in 2024.
  • From 2015 to 2023, new malaria cases fell by 80%.
  • 24 states and UTs are in category 1, reporting less than 1 case per 1,000 population.
“India’s journey toward a malaria-free future is a story of remarkable transformation and progress.” - Union Health Ministry

In conclusion, the health ministry emphasizes that India's proactive public health strategies have been crucial in combating malaria, paving the way for potential elimination by 2030.
newTitle: India Poised to Achieve Malaria-Free Status by 2030

title: 'Free Imran Khan': PTI welcomes Trump's aide statement as PML-N calls for 'respecting sovereignty' - Geo News
summary:
Free Imran Khan: PTI welcomes Trump's aide statement as PML-N calls for 'respecting sovereignty'

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Geo TV

The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) party has responded positively to Richard Grenell's statement advocating for the release of its leader, Imran Khan. The ruling Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) has, however, emphasized the need to respect national sovereignty.

  • PTI's Zartaj Gul, Aliya Hamza welcome Grenell's remarks.
  • PTI wants Imran's freedom in line with Constitution: Gohar.
  • PML-N's Talal rules out Imran's release on US pressure.

“Release Imran Khan,” Grenell tweeted, highlighting his long-standing relationship with the former prime minister during Trump's presidency.

“There are a lot of the same allegations just like President Trump, where the ruling party put him in prison and created some sort of corruption allegations and false allegations.”

The reaction from PML-N suggests a firm stance against any foreign pressure, emphasizing that Imran Khan's case is an internal matter.
newTitle: PTI Welcomes Trump's Aide Call for Imran Khan's Release Amidst PML-N's Call for Sovereignty

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

In a recent government reshuffle, Arunish Chawla has been appointed as the new revenue secretary, while Vineet Joshi, the Chief Secretary of Manipur, will take on the role of education secretary. This move is expected to enhance the administrative efficiency in their respective departments.

  • Arunish Chawla replaces the outgoing revenue secretary.
  • Vineet Joshi aims to reform the education sector in Manipur.
  • The appointments are part of a broader government reorganization.

title: Pakistan bring back Babar and go with four pacers for Centurion Test - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Pakistan Bring Back Babar and Opt for Four Pacers in Centurion Test

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Pakistan will face South Africa in the Boxing Day Test at Centurion with a bowling attack featuring four pacers and no specialist spinner, marking the return of Babar Azam to the lineup.

Key Points:

  • Babar Azam returns to the team after being dropped from the previous Tests against England.
  • Pakistan selects four seamers: Aamer Jamal, Naseem Shah, Mohammad Abbas, and Khurram Shahzad.
  • Shan Masood will open alongside Saim Ayub, while Abdullah Shafique has been left out due to poor form.
  • The team has opted for an all-pace attack, considering the seam-friendly conditions of the Centurion pitch.
“Since the Australia series, we've backed Aamer Jamal... He’s handy when it reverses and useful at being the enforcer.” - Shan Masood

This match will be critical as both teams rely on seam bowling, highlighting the importance of pitch conditions for the upcoming Test.
newTitle: Pakistan Bring Back Babar and Opt for Four Pacers in Centurion Test

title: Vivo Y29 5G launched in India with Military Grade durability: All you need to know - India TV News
summary:
Vivo Y29 5G launched in India with Military Grade durability: All you need to know

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: India TV News

Vivo has unveiled the Vivo Y29 5G in India, a mid-range smartphone priced from Rs 13,999. It features military-grade durability with an IP64 rating for dust and splash resistance.

  • Dil Raju has stated that the entire film industry will meet CM Reddy.

title: N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
N Srinivasan Resigns as CEO and MD of India Cements Following UltraTech Deal

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: Live Mint

N Srinivasan, the CEO and MD of India Cements, has resigned along with other board members after UltraTech Cement's acquisition of a significant stake in the company.

  • N Srinivasan stepped down after UltraTech's 32% acquisition of India Cements.
  • UltraTech Cement acquired 10.13 crore equity shares of India Cements.
  • This acquisition results in India Cements becoming a subsidiary of UltraTech Cement.
  • Several other board members, including Rupa Gurunath and Chitra Srinivasan, also resigned.
“Srinivasan's resignation follows the completion of the acquisition and the cessation of control by the existing promoters.”

This change marks a significant shift in the leadership of India Cements following its acquisition by UltraTech, indicating a new direction for the company under its new ownership.
newTitle: N Srinivasan Resigns as CEO and MD of India Cements Following UltraTech Deal

title: N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal - Mint
summary:
N Srinivasan resigns as CEO, MD of India Cements after CCI approves ₹7,000-crore UltraTech deal

Publication Date: December 25, 2024

Source: Live Mint

N Srinivasan has resigned from his position as CEO and MD of India Cements following UltraTech Cement's acquisition of a 32 percent stake in the company, resulting in its classification as a subsidiary.

  • N Srinivasan and several board members stepped down after the acquisition.
  • The Competition Commission of India approved UltraTech's ₹7,000-crore deal for significant ownership of India Cements.
  • UltraTech now holds approximately 55.49% of India Cements' equity share capital.
  • New directors have been appointed to the board post-resignation.
“UltraTech has acquired sole control of the company and has become the promoter.”

This acquisition marks a significant shift in the Indian cement industry, where consolidation and competition between major corporate groups are intensifying.
newTitle: N Srinivasan Resigns as CEO of India Cements Following UltraTech Acquisition
